issue.title: [CF 639] LibSpellRange not present when TellMeWhen installed using nolib option
issue.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Install TellMeWhen with "Install Libraries Separately" option

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
TellMeWhen fails because LibSpellRange is not present

What version of the product are you using?
TellMeWhen r622

Do you have an error log of what happened?
n/a

Please provide any additional information below.
For some reason, the zip file for LibSpellRange-1.0, which is available on the CurseForge project site, is not visible from the Curse.com page for LibSpellRange.  Apparently, this isn't enough for the curse client to find it when asked to install libraries separately.


> Posted by CurseForge user Gronzig | Imported from CurseForge issue #639 | Raw

comments.body:
Disabled nolib creation for all future versions until Curse can figure out how to syndicate things properly.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I've turned nolib creation back on now (for r626), as it seems that LSR is now properly syndicating with Curse.com

Let me know if it still isn't working.

Edited Oct 1, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
